channel.title: WSJ.com : U.S. News
channel.description: Read the latest and breaking national US News covering Law, Politics, Education, Crime and College Rankings as well as the impact of climate on the environment.
channel.copyright: Copyright © Dow Jones & Company, Inc. All rights reserved.

item.title: The Former Insurance Lawyer Trump Picked to Take On Comey
item.description: Lindsey Halligan, the interim U.S. Attorney for the Eastern District of Virginia, worked around the clock to secure indictment of the former FBI director.
item.dc:creator: Meridith McGraw
C. Ryan Barber
Lydia Wheeler

item.title: Trump Says He Is Ordering Troops to Portland, Escalating Domestic Use of Military
item.description: In a social-media post the president called the Oregon city “War Ravaged” and said soldiers would have authority to use force.
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Calfas
Robbie Gramer

item.title: Trump Administration Asks Supreme Court to Uphold Ban on Birthright Citizenship
item.description: The administration wants a final ruling on President Trump’s bid to end the practice of granting citizenship to anyone born on U.S. soil.
item.dc:creator: Mariah Timms
Lydia Wheeler

item.title: Sonoma’s Bold Idea to Woo Younger Wine Drinkers: Raise Prices
item.description: In the famed wine country, trade leaders proposed a new ‘tax’ to offset the graying consumer base. The backlash was swift.
item.dc:creator: Jim Carlton

item.title: Inside the Crisis at Tylenol
item.description: The CEO behind Tylenol thought he’d found a way to work with the Trump administration. Then everything went off the rails.
item.dc:creator: Peter Loftus
Alyssa Lukpat
Sara Ashley O’Brien

item.title: Former Financier Howard Rubin Charged With Sex-Trafficking
item.description: The onetime portfolio manager of the Soros Fund is accused by federal prosecutors of assaulting women he paid for sex.
item.dc:creator: James Fanelli

item.title: At the Epicenter of School Choice, Arizona Public Schools Battle Existential Crisis
item.description: Educators fight back against falling enrollments and rising competition. One idea: mimic restaurant-industry focus on customer service.
item.dc:creator: Matt Barnum

item.title: Oklahoma’s Top Education Official Who Pushed for Bibles in Schools to Resign
item.description: Ryan Walters said he is stepping down to join the Teacher Freedom Alliance, a conservative education group, as its CEO.
item.dc:creator: Joseph De Avila
Matt Barnum

item.title: American Colleges Are Going All Out to Hold On to International Students
item.description: International students contributed $43.8 billion to the U.S. economy in a recent year.
item.dc:creator: Sara Randazzo

item.title: Texas A&M President Steps Down After Fallout Over Gender Teaching
item.description: Mark Welsh was under fire from conservatives after a video of gender discussion during a literature class went viral.
item.dc:creator: Gareth Vipers

item.title: How One High-School Teacher Tells Her Gen-Z Students the Story of Capitalism
item.description: For Rachel Money, the economic system is more than the definitions. It’s about giving her students the knowledge to understand and navigate the world.
item.dc:creator: Heidi Mitchell

item.title: What to Know About the Criminal Case Against James Comey
item.description: Prosecutors allege the former FBI director lied to Congress, but legal experts say there are significant hurdles to overcome.
item.dc:creator: Jess Bravin

item.title: Read an Annotated Version of James Comey’s Indictment
item.description: The former FBI director has portrayed the case as the cost of standing up to President Trump.
item.dc:creator: Corinne Ramey
Kara Dapena

item.title: Trump Pledges That Others Will Be Indicted After Comey
item.description: Critics said the Justice Department was at an inflection point, with the president calling the shots.
item.dc:creator: Annie Linskey
Meridith McGraw

item.title: James Comey Indicted on False Statement Charges
item.description: The federal prosecution comes after President Trump pressured the attorney general to bring the case against the former FBI director.
item.dc:creator: Sadie Gurman
Lydia Wheeler

item.title: Justice Department Officials Race to Charge James Comey as Deadline Looms
item.description: Prosecutors are moving forward days after President Trump ousted the U.S. attorney who voiced doubts about charging the former FBI director.
item.dc:creator: Sadie Gurman
Josh Dawsey

item.title: Home-Energy Tax Credits Are Expiring Soon. Act Fast.
item.description: The credits aren’t right for everybody. But for some people, they can save a lot of money.
item.dc:creator: Lisa Ward

item.title: Punishing Droughts Put Fresh Pressure on Meat and Dairy Production
item.description: Investors are calling for farm-based businesses to address increasing concerns about their water use.
item.dc:creator: Clara Hudson

item.title: North Carolina’s Outer Banks Brace for Hurricane Erin
item.description: Local officials issued evacuation orders for parts of the Outer Banks, warning that the storm might wash out roads.
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Calfas
Tali Arbel

item.title: Feeling Especially Hot and Sticky This Summer? Now There’s a Metric for That
item.description: Summer heat across the Eastern U.S. is off the charts in a new ‘stickiness’ measurement that combines heat and humidity.
item.dc:creator: Carl Churchill

item.title: Juneau Avoids Disastrous Glacier Flood
item.description: City officials say the flood threat has ended and credit barriers with preventing more damage from the Mendenhall Glacier outburst
item.dc:creator: Joseph De Avila

item.title: A Timeline of Key Moments in American Capitalism
item.description: From the Declaration of Independence, to railroads, to the rise of conglomerates: Here are 51 seminal moments in the development of U.S. capitalism.
item.dc:creator: Louis Hyman

item.title: Name That Brand: Do You Remember These Famous Icons?
item.description: Some of the most familiar advertising icons go back to the 1800s. How many do you recognize?
item.dc:creator: William Power

item.title: Wall Street Has Had Its Own Language for Centuries. How Well Do You Speak It?
item.description: A quiz on the jargon that traders and brokerage firms have used over the years.
item.dc:creator: Beth DeCarbo

item.title: When Boring Became Beautiful for Stock-Market Investors
item.description: Index funds were first considered nonsense. That nonsense now rules among many individual investors.
item.dc:creator: Allan Sloan

item.title: What Will U.S. Capitalism Look Like in 50 Years? Seven Experts Weigh In
item.description: The predictions—some hopeful, some not—offer different visions for the future.

item.title: Opinion | The Comey-Trump Revenge Cycle
item.description: It’s a historic tragedy the President didn’t fire Comey in 2017.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: Opinion | How to Diminish the Dangers of Social Media
item.description: TikTok, Instagram and other platforms can be noxious, especially for young minds. What can we do about it?

item.title: Opinion | California Learns From Mississippi on Phonics
item.description: The Golden State is now following the Magnolia State’s phonics success.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: Opinion | Worse Than a Criminal, Comey Is a Blunderer
item.description: A Trump-led prosecution is a miserable substitute for an honest account of one very tall black swan.
item.dc:creator: Holman W. Jenkins, Jr.

item.title: Opinion | The Right Needs to Conserve Free Speech
item.description: It’s tempting to follow the left’s lead and censor one’s foes, but a FIRE co-founder Harvey Silverglate says it’s unwise.
item.dc:creator: Tunku Varadarajan

item.title: Opinion | What We Don’t Know About Tylenol and Autism
item.description: There is a correlation, but it could turn out to be the result of genetic factors.
item.dc:creator: Michael Segal

item.title: Federal Agents Heading to Memphis as Part of Trump’s Crime Crackdown
item.description: The Tennessee National Guard will play a support role but won’t be making arrests, Gov. Bill Lee said.
item.dc:creator: Joseph De Avila

item.title: New York City Office Shooter Had CTE, Medical Examiner Finds
item.description: Shane Tamura was diagnosed postmortem with the brain disease associated with head injuries and often found in football players.
item.dc:creator: Jack Morphet

item.title: Douglas Wilson Wants the U.S. to Be a Christian Republic. MAGA Is Listening.
item.description: The incendiary pastor calls for taking away women’s right to vote and barring non-Christians from holding office. Pete Hegseth and Tucker Carlson are among his fans.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Zitner

item.title: Texas Officials Identify Joshua Jahn as Suspect in Dallas ICE Shooting
item.description: Authorities believe the suspect acted alone in the attack that killed one and critically injured two.

item.title: Do I Get Taxed on a High-Yield Savings Account?
item.description: Interest earned on a high-yield savings account is usually taxed as ordinary income in your regular tax bracket. Interest is reported on your tax return.
item.dc:creator: Miranda Marquit

item.title: Home Equity Loan vs. Home Equity Line of Credit (Heloc)
item.description: Decide whether a home equity loan or line of credit is best suited for your financial goals.

item.title: Current Mortgage Rates for August 2025
item.description: Today’s mortgage rates remain under 7% — learn how to get the best home loan rates.
item.dc:creator: Miranda Marquit

item.title: Shooting at Dallas ICE Facility Leaves One Detainee Dead
item.description: A gunman opened fire and shot three people inside a van in an entryway of the building. Two other detainees were critically injured.
